result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan P. Beckius

records.addlTxt:
10:57 AM Defendant Alan P. Beckius in court.  Attorney Nils Wyosnick in court for Alan P. Beckius.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court makes record in re. disqualification and right to refusal. 
 Defendant waives right to recusal.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently waives right to preliminary hearing.     Information to be filed today but does mirror the complaint.  Waiver of formal reading of the information.  Defendant stands mute - not guilty plea entered.
Status conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on December 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Booking; no violent, abusive or profane conduct.  Defendant is to contact the Iowa County Sheriff's Department at 608-930-9500 to make arrangements for booking by 10/07/2022.

9:01 AM Defendant Alan P. Beckius in court.  Attorney Zachary Leigh in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Court advises defendant of representation rights/options.  Defendant will contact SPD.  $1000 signature bond - no violent, abusive or profane conducts.  Court will address any disqualification/recusal requests at next hearing.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
